intro: Tryphostemma polygaloides, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its woody stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that has been traditionally used for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are often used in local remedies for treating ailments such as inflammation and skin conditions. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife and preventing soil erosion.
